intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests and is often found in lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
